_comment: Created by NCODowd on 16/11/2016 17:22:30 using v2.7
title: What proportion of calls are resolved without a person needing to go to hospital?
analysis_commentary:
As the majority of people who call 999 are in an emergency situation which requires urgent support, the proportion of calls which were resolved with telephone advice only was low. From April 2011 to November 2013, this was roughly 5.0% of calls. However, from November 2013 to June 2015 there was a steady increase in calls resolved with telephone advice only. By April 2015 this doubled to 10% of calls.
Roughly one third of calls to 999 were visited by an ambulance but the person did not need to go to hospital. This has increased from 33% in April 2011 to 38% in April 2016.

Updated November 2016
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
